questions.question: I don't want you to bring ........................... that topic again.
questions.description: To bring up a topic is to mention it.

questions.question: The teacher asked the boy to do the exercise .............................
questions.description: To do something over is to repeat it.

questions.question: She filled ................................ the bottle with water.
questions.description: To fill up a bottle is to fill it to capacity.

questions.question: I found that she had been saying nasty things about me behind my ............................
questions.description: To do something behind someone's back is to do something without their knowledge.

questions.question: The restaurant was giving ................................. free food.
questions.description: To give something away is to give it for free.

questions.question: When are you going to give me my money .................................?
questions.description: To give something back is to return it.

questions.question: Put ............................... your coat before going out.
questions.description: To put on a coat is to wear it.

questions.question: We use a fire extinguisher to put ............................... fire.
questions.description: To put out fire is to extinguish it.

questions.question: Please take ................................ these instructions lest you should forget them.
questions.description: To take down is to make a written note.

questions.question: You must put .................................... some money for your retirement.
questions.description: To put something away is to save or store it.

questions.question: Although he deserved the job, his application was turned ..............................
questions.description: To turn something down is to reject it.

questions.question: We should not throw .................................. anything useful.
questions.description: To throw something away is to discard it.
